main.name: Morgan Radic
main.description: I love creating Scalable Backend Systems and working with AWS.
main.bio: I am a developer and architect with 4+ years of experience implementing backend systems within AWS.  Through my work I have helped multiple organizations create scalable APIs, most often utilizing a Serverless architecture.  Outside of my work you can find me either cooking, backpacking, hiking, golfing, or playing volleyball.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here are some of my most proficient technologies.

education.degree: Bachelors in Information Sciences and Technology

work.title: Software Development Engineer
work.description: Working on a full stack project using a React frontend, Java API, and CDK for the IaC

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Worked within a team that managed multiple APIs using ECS and Sprint Boot.

work.title: Consultant
work.description: Our client was using Kafka to stream machine learning data to a plethora of applications.  I joined a team that was developing two Java Spring applications that would consume this data and communicate it with their customers via email and a RESTful API. On this team I was a Java developer and helped with some of the AWS architecture.

work.title: Consultant
work.description: We worked with our client to create a React SPA website that would consume data from a scalable API.  I proposed a Serverless architecture due to the fact that the traffic would be variable throughout the year and relatively light.  The speed of a Serverless API coupled with the low-costs further drove home this decision.  My role on the team was developing the API and architecting the system within AWS.

work.title: Consultant
work.description: Our client had a large initiative to rewrite many outdated Java APIs to be entirely Serverless in order to cut costs.  I worked on a team to rewrite one of their large scale APIs that provided data for hundreds of dealership sites.  We also developed a corresponding Angular SPA website that interacted with the API and migrated their large MySQL database to DynamoDB in order for the database to fit our low-cost, highly available architecture. My role on the team was architecting the system in AWS and developing both the front end and the API.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
